main event: On July 7, 1955, at China Lake NAS, California, a round orangish-red object, the size of a dime held at arm's length, was observed on ground radar, making rapid changes in direction, speed, and altitude. It was also visually observed by pilots in the area.
interesting points: The object was first sighted in the northwestern sky, appeared to be glowing, and exhibited rapid changes in speed and direction.
Multiple witnesses, including a control tower operator and pilots, observed the object, adding to the credibility of the sighting.
The object's behavior included standing still, rapid movements, and disappearance for several seconds at a time, with no regular pattern.
Weather conditions at the time of the sighting were clear with a slight breeze, and the object was estimated to be at a high altitude
The report includes multiple interviews with different control tower operators and air facility officers, providing detailed descriptions of the object's appearance and behavior.
sighted object: round orangish-red object exhibiting rapid and unpredictable movements
photographs: No photographs were included in the report
